00014 const UINT32 DriverStationLCD::kSyncTimeout_ms;
00015 const UINT16 DriverStationLCD::kFullDisplayTextCommand;
00016 const INT32 DriverStationLCD::kLineLength;
00017 const INT32 DriverStationLCD::kNumLines;

00025 DriverStationLCD::DriverStationLCD()
00026     : m_textBuffer (NULL)
00027     , m_textBufferSemaphore (NULL)
00028 {
00029     m_textBuffer = new char[USER_DS_LCD_DATA_SIZE];
00030     memset(m_textBuffer, ' ', USER_DS_LCD_DATA_SIZE);
00031 
00032     *((UINT16 *)m_textBuffer) = kFullDisplayTextCommand;
00033 
00034     m_textBufferSemaphore = semMCreate(SEM_DELETE_SAFE | SEM_INVERSION_SAFE);
00035 
00036     AddToSingletonList();
00037 }
00038 
00039 DriverStationLCD::~DriverStationLCD()
00040 {
00041     semDelete(m_textBufferSemaphore);
00042     delete [] m_textBuffer;
00043     m_instance = NULL;
00044 }
00045 
00049 DriverStationLCD* DriverStationLCD::GetInstance()
00050 {
00051     if (m_instance == NULL)
00052     {
00053         m_instance = new DriverStationLCD();
00054     }
00055     return m_instance;
00056 }

00061 void DriverStationLCD::UpdateLCD()
00062 {
00063     Synchronized sync(m_textBufferSemaphore);
00064     setUserDsLcdData(m_textBuffer, USER_DS_LCD_DATA_SIZE, kSyncTimeout_ms);
00065 }
00066 
00076 void DriverStationLCD::Printf(Line line, INT32 startingColumn, const char *writeFmt, ...)
00077 {
00078     va_list args;
00079     UINT32 start = startingColumn - 1;
00080     INT32 maxLength = kLineLength - start;
00081     char lineBuffer[kLineLength + 1];
00082 
00083     if (startingColumn < 1 || startingColumn > kLineLength)
00084     {
00085         wpi_fatal(ParameterOutOfRange);
00086         return;
00087     }
00088 
00089     if (line < kMain_Line6 || line > kUser_Line6)
00090     {
00091         wpi_fatal(ParameterOutOfRange);
00092         return;
00093     }
00094 
00095     va_start (args, writeFmt);
00096     {
00097         Synchronized sync(m_textBufferSemaphore);
00098         // snprintf appends NULL to its output.  Therefore we can't write directly to the buffer.
00099         INT32 length = vsnprintf(lineBuffer, kLineLength + 1, writeFmt, args);
00100         if (length < 0) length = kLineLength;
00101 
00102         memcpy(m_textBuffer + start + line * kLineLength + sizeof(UINT16), lineBuffer, std::min(maxLength,length));
00103     }
00104 
00105     va_end (args);
00106 }
00107 
00117 void DriverStationLCD::PrintfLine(Line line, const char *writeFmt, ...)
00118 {
00119     va_list args;
00120     char lineBuffer[kLineLength + 1];
00121 
00122     if (line < kMain_Line6 || line > kUser_Line6)
00123     {
00124         wpi_fatal(ParameterOutOfRange);
00125         return;
00126     }
00127 
00128     va_start (args, writeFmt);
00129     {
00130         Synchronized sync(m_textBufferSemaphore);
00131         // snprintf appends NULL to its output.  Therefore we can't write directly to the buffer.
00132         INT32 length = std::min(vsnprintf(lineBuffer, kLineLength + 1, writeFmt, args), kLineLength);
00133         if (length < 0) length = kLineLength;
00134 
00135         // Fill the rest of the buffer
00136         if (length < kLineLength)
00137         {
00138             memset(lineBuffer + length, ' ', kLineLength - length);
00139         }
00140         
00141         memcpy(m_textBuffer + line * kLineLength + sizeof(UINT16), lineBuffer, kLineLength);
00142     }
00143 
00144     va_end (args);
00145 }
00146 
00150 void DriverStationLCD::Clear()
00151 {
00152     Synchronized sync(m_textBufferSemaphore);
00153     memset(m_textBuffer + sizeof(UINT16), ' ', kLineLength*kNumLines);
00154 }
